website_summaries.verdict: New Balance updates its 896 series with the drop of the lightweight and speedy version 3. The mesh upper and perforated tongue provide a light and breathable environment for the foot. It’s bolstered in areas that need support to keep the foot stable without the extra weight. This hard court option is treated with a track spike-inspired tread for traction.
pros: The bulk of the reviewers claim that the New Balance 896 v3 is light and fast
Many satisfied users praise its soft upper as it holds their foot in place
Comments from a reasonable sum of players say this trainer has solid traction on the hard court
Many are impressed by its durability
This trainer provides sufficient room for custom orthotics, several users describe
cons: According to few reviews, the support around the collar is quite feeble
Some who play long hours wish this footgear had more cushioning

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for tennis!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. The shoe fit perfectly out of the box and required no breaking in whatsoever. It's so nice that New Balance has the option to get wide and extra wide sizing for their shoes unlike some other companies. Also, the price point of $43 before I used points was killer. I noticed the shoe shot up to $110 in the last month--talk about a price difference.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Runs Narrow
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with plantar fascia pain several years ago, I've learned to go no higher than a 6mm heel drop in my running shoe. It's hard to find a tennis shoe without significantly larger heel drops. This one hits the mark. There's not a lot of cushioning here, but the shoes are really responsive, light and quick on the court. I'm pleased with the breathability and durable materials. Based on the other reviews, I ordered my usual size (11.5 M) but went with 2E I'm really glad I ordered a wider shoe. This model does seem incredibly narrow. I've still got plenty of room in the toe to protect the nails on hard jump stops.
customer_reviews.author: David Callon

customer_reviews.title: Consistently a good product
customer_reviews.text: NB896v3 is another great shoe. I have had several NB shoes over the years and they never disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Narciso Narvais

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit, Great styling, Cushioning Below Average
customer_reviews.text: I improved the cushioning problem by removing the thin insole and replacing it with a Dr. Scholl's Sport Gel Insole.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: NB shoes always run a little small,so keep that in mind. Shoes are comfortable and seem pretty good expect for the NB emblem and stripes are peeling off and they are only two weeks old. Glad I found them on sale because I would be pissed if I paid full price of $100.00
customer_reviews.author: neal

customer_reviews.title: Just not courtly.
customer_reviews.text: An ill-fitting, cheaply made plastic shoe with inadequate lace length. A new low for New Balance. The downward slide continues.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Best tennis shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe and very comfortable. Best tennis shoe I have own , will see how they hold up with time.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Villavasso

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and perfect for tennis!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice tennis shoes. They’re very comfortable and perfect for tennis.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Great Tennis Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit my wide foot well. Solid, stable feel on Har-Tru and hard courts.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: good court shoe
customer_reviews.text: like the style and color, have liked all my New Balance shoes
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Danner

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery from tennis express. Fits well; my son has used this model for a few years now.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McAlvanah

customer_reviews.title: Toe box wear
customer_reviews.text: Good comfortable shoe, but lacks in out sole longevity around the toe box. I bought these shoes 3 months ago and my toe box on my left and right shoe has show wear to foam sole. Now my left shoe has visible wear into the inner sole of the shoe. Not the greatest shoe for heavy movment game play but descent for an average movement.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph O Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I expect better of New Balance. Big 5 sporting goods would reject these as too poorly made. Which would be a first for Big 5.
customer_reviews.author: clarence johnson

customer_reviews.title: fits great and love the light weight
customer_reviews.text: the 2E-Wide fits me very well. I also like that the shoe is light and provide good support at the same time. Makes moving on the court so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but hard materials around big toe
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect but the scrape guard on the inside big toe area is bothersome when shoe is articulated at that point.
customer_reviews.author: felix abreu

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale and was shocked at how comfortable they are given how light they are. They are similar in feel to Asics Solution Speed FF, but even lighter. I do question a little the long-term durability as they are super light, but they have held up well so far and would say they are more durable than the typical Nike sneakers would be. They aren't as sticky as some sneakers, so if you like a little slide in your shots on hard courts and you like a light game-day sneaker, this may be the one.
customer_reviews.author: Tennisjon

customer_reviews.title: Great look
customer_reviews.text: Order 1/2 size up than usual, looks great 👍 on fit, got lot of compliments, great tennis shoe, really grip the court.
customer_reviews.author: Ziauddin Ahmed

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 896v3 Hard Court Tennis Shoe
product_meta.description: Not Water Resistant and a synthetic fabric
